The proposal id is produced by hashing the ABI encoded `targets` array, the `values` array, the `calldatas` array and the descriptionHash (bytes32 which itself is the keccak256 hash of the description string). This proposal id can be produced from the proposal data which is part of the {ProposalCreated} event. It can even be computed in advance, before the proposal is submitted. Note that the chainId and the governor address are not part of the proposal id computation. Consequently, the same proposal (with same operation and same description) will have the same id if submitted on multiple governors across multiple networks. Developers should keep in mind that\n     * this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function\n     * uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block.\n     */\n    function values(AddressSet storage set) internal view returns (address[] memory) {\n        bytes32[] memory store = _values(set._inner);\n        address[] memory result;\n\n        /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly\n        assembly {\n            result := store\n        }\n\n        return result;\n    }\n\n    // UintSet\n\n    struct UintSet {\n        Set _inner;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Add a value to a set. O(1).\n     *\n     * Returns true if the value was added to the set, that is if it was not\n     * already present.\n     */\n    function add(UintSet storage set, uint256 value) internal returns (bool) {\n        return _add(set._inner, bytes32(value));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Removes a value from a set. =0.8.17;\n\nimport '@openzeppelin/contracts/access/AccessControlEnumerable.sol';\nimport '@openzeppelin/contracts/security/ReentrancyGuard.sol';\nimport '@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/extensions/ERC20Votes.sol';\nimport '@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol';\nimport './interfaces/AggregatorV3Interface.sol';\nimport './interfaces/AggregationRouterV5Interface.sol';\nimport './interfaces/IUniswapV2Router01.sol';\n\ncontract InzenFunds is AccessControlEnumerable, ERC20Votes, ReentrancyGuard {\n    using SafeERC20 for ERC20;\n\n    bytes32 public constant PORTFOLIO_ENGINEER_ROLE = keccak256('PORTFOLIO_ENGINEER_ROLE');\n\n    struct Assets {\n        ERC20 token;\n        AggregatorV3Interface priceFeed;\n        uint256 amount;\n        uint256 weight;\n    }\n\n    Assets[] public portfolio;\n    mapping(ERC20 => uint256) private tokenIdx;\n    AggregationRouterV5Interface public router;\n    ERC20 public baseToken;\n\n    event Deposit(address indexed user, uint256 baseAmount, uint256 mintAmount);\n    event Withdraw(address indexed user, uint256 baseAmount, uint256 burnAmount);\n    event Rebalance(ERC20 indexed fromToken, ERC20 indexed toToken, uint256 fromAmount, uint256 toAmount);\n    event Reconfigure(uint256[] weights);\n    event AddAsset(ERC20 indexed token, AggregatorV3Interface priceFeed);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Initialize the contract\n     * @param _name: Fund name\n     * @param _baseToken: deposit token\n     * @param _router: 1inch aggregation router\n     * @param _portfolio: desired asset allocation\n     */\n    constructor(\n        string memory _name,\n        ERC20 _baseToken,\n        AggregationRouterV5Interface _router,\n        Assets[] memory _portfolio\n    ) ERC20(_name, 'IZF') ERC20Permit(_name) {\n        baseToken = _baseToken;\n        router = _router;\n\n        uint256 totalWeight = 0;\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < _portfolio.length; i++) {\n            require(tokenIdx[_portfolio[i].token] == 0, 'Duplicated asset');\n            require(baseToken != _portfolio[i].token && _portfolio[i].amount == 0, 'Invalid asset');\n            portfolio.push(_portfolio[i]);\n            tokenIdx[_portfolio[i].token] = portfolio.length;\n            totalWeight += _portfolio[i].weight;\n        }\n        require(totalWeight == 100, 'Invalid asset weights');\n\n        _setupRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, _msgSender());\n        _setupRole(PORTFOLIO_ENGINEER_ROLE, _msgSender());\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Invest in the fund to receive fund token\n     * @param _amount: amount of base token to deposit\n     * @param _swapdata: tx.data from 1inch api for swap base token to each asset in porfolio\n     * @dev call `https://api.1inch.io/v5.0/${chainId}/swap?fromTokenAddress=${baseToken}&toTokenAddress=${toToken}&amount=${amount}&fromAddress=${poolAddress}&slippage=1&disableEstimate=true`\n     */\n    function deposit(uint256 _amount, bytes[] calldata _swapdata) external nonReentrant {\n        require(_swapdata.length == portfolio.length, 'Invalid swap data');\n\n        uint256 oldValue = totalValue();\n        baseToken.safeTransferFrom(msg.sender, address(this), _amount);\n        baseToken.safeApprove(address(router), _amount);\n\n        uint256 totalSpent = 0;\n        address executor;\n        AggregationRouterV5Interface.SwapDescription memory desc;\n        bytes memory permit;\n        bytes memory data;\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < _swapdata.length; i++) {\n            (executor, desc, permit, data) = abi.decode(\n                _swapdata[i][4:],\n                (address, AggregationRouterV5Interface.SwapDescription, bytes, bytes)\n            );\n            require(desc.dstReceiver == address(this), 'Invalid receiver');\n            require(desc.srcToken == baseToken && desc.dstToken == portfolio[i].token, 'Invalid swap token');\n            require(desc.amount == (portfolio[i].weight * _amount) / 100, 'Invalid swap amount');\n            (uint256 returnAmount, uint256 spentAmount) = router.swap(executor, desc, permit, data);\n            portfolio[i].amount += returnAmount;\n            totalSpent += spentAmount;\n        }\n\n        require(totalSpent <= _amount, 'Spent more than deposit');\n        if (totalSpent < _amount) {\n            baseToken.safeTransfer(msg.sender, _amount - totalSpent);\n        }\n\n        uint256 newValue = totalValue();\n        require(oldValue < newValue, 'New value can not less than old value');\n        uint256 mintAmount = newValue * 10**12;\n        if (oldValue > 0) {\n            mintAmount = ((newValue - oldValue) * totalSupply()) / oldValue;\n        }\n        _mint(msg.sender, mintAmount);\n        emit Deposit(msg.sender, totalSpent, mintAmount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Burn fund token to get back assets\n     * @param _burnAmount: amount of fund token to withdraw\n     */\n    function withdraw(uint256 _burnAmount) external nonReentrant {\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < portfolio.length; i++) {\n            uint256 returnAmount = (portfolio[i].amount * _burnAmount) / totalSupply();\n            portfolio[i].amount -= returnAmount;\n            portfolio[i].token.safeTransfer(msg.sender, returnAmount);\n        }\n        _burn(msg.sender, _burnAmount);\n        emit Withdraw(msg.sender, 0, _burnAmount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Burn fund token to get back base token\n     * @param _burnAmount: amount of fund token to withdraw\n     */\n    function uniWithdraw(uint256 _burnAmount, IUniswapV2Router01 _uniRouter) external nonReentrant {\n        address[] memory path = new address[](2);\n        path[1] = address(baseToken);\n\n        uint256 totalReturn = 0;\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < portfolio.length; i++) {\n            uint256 returnAmount = (portfolio[i].amount * _burnAmount) / totalSupply();\n            portfolio[i].amount -= returnAmount;\n            portfolio[i].token.safeApprove(address(_uniRouter), returnAmount);\n            path[0] = address(portfolio[i].token);\n\n            uint256[] memory amounts = _uniRouter.swapExactTokensForTokens(\n                returnAmount,\n                0,\n                path,\n                msg.sender,\n                block.timestamp\n            );\n            totalReturn += amounts[0];\n        }\n        _burn(msg.sender, _burnAmount);\n        emit Withdraw(msg.sender, totalReturn, _burnAmount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Swap token in pool to maintain the desired allocation\n     * @param _swapdata: tx.data from 1inch api for swap assets in porfolio\n     * @dev call `https://api.1inch.io/v5.0/${chainId}/swap?fromTokenAddress=${fromToken}&toTokenAddress=${toToken}&amount=${amount}&fromAddress=${poolAddress}&slippage=1&disableEstimate=true`\n     */\n    function rebalance(bytes[] calldata _swapdata) external onlyRole(PORTFOLIO_ENGINEER_ROLE) nonReentrant {\n        address executor;\n        AggregationRouterV5Interface.SwapDescription memory desc;\n        bytes memory permit;\n        bytes memory data;\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < _swapdata.length; i++) {\n            (executor, desc, permit, data) = abi.decode(\n                _swapdata[i][4:],\n                (address, AggregationRouterV5Interface.SwapDescription, bytes, bytes)\n            );\n            require(desc.dstReceiver == address(this), 'Invalid receiver');\n            require(tokenIdx[desc.srcToken] != 0 && tokenIdx[desc.dstToken] != 0, 'Invalid swap token');\n            desc.srcToken.safeApprove(address(router), desc.amount);\n            (uint256 returnAmount, uint256 spentAmount) = router.swap(executor, desc, permit, data);\n            portfolio[tokenIdx[desc.srcToken] - 1].amount -= spentAmount;\n            portfolio[tokenIdx[desc.dstToken] - 1].amount += returnAmount;\n            emit Rebalance(desc.srcToken, desc.dstToken, spentAmount, returnAmount);\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Update desired allocation\n     * @param _weights: weights of each asset\n     */\n    function reconfigure(uint256[] memory _weights) external onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {\n        require(_weights.length == portfolio.length, 'Invalid length');\n        uint256 totalWeight = 0;\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < _weights.length; i++) {\n            portfolio[i].weight = _weights[i];\n            totalWeight += _weights[i];\n        }\n        require(totalWeight == 100, 'Invalid asset weights');\n        emit Reconfigure(_weights);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Add new asset with weight = 0\n     * @param _token: token address\n     * @param _priceFeed: chainlink price feed\n     */\n    function addAsset(ERC20 _token, AggregatorV3Interface _priceFeed) external onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {\n        require(tokenIdx[_token] == 0, 'Duplicated asset');\n        portfolio.push(Assets(_token, _priceFeed, 0, 0));\n        tokenIdx[_token] = portfolio.length;\n        emit AddAsset(_token, _priceFeed);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Get fund overview\n     */\n    function overview()\n        external\n        view\n        returns (\n            string memory fundName,\n            uint256 usdValue,\n            uint256 tokenSupply,\n            Assets[] memory assets\n        )\n    {\n        fundName = name();\n        usdValue = totalValue();\n        tokenSupply = totalSupply();\n        assets = new Assets[](portfolio.length);\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < portfolio.length; i++) {\n            assets[i] = portfolio[i];\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Get user investment info\n     */\n    function userInfo(address user)\n        external\n        view\n        returns (\n            uint256 usdValue,\n            uint256 tokenBalance,\n            bool isPorfolioEngineer\n        )\n    {\n        tokenBalance = balanceOf(user);\n        if (tokenBalance > 0) {\n            usdValue = (totalValue() * tokenBalance) / totalSupply();\n        }\n        isPorfolioEngineer = hasRole(PORTFOLIO_ENGINEER_ROLE, user);\n    }\n\n    function totalValue() public view returns (uint256 total) {\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < portfolio.length; i++) {\n            if (portfolio[i].amount == 0) continue;\n            (, int256 answer, , , ) = portfolio[i].priceFeed.latestRoundData();\n            uint8 priceDecimals = portfolio[i].priceFeed.decimals();\n            uint8 tokenDecimals = portfolio[i].token.decimals();\n            total += (uint256(answer) * portfolio[i].amount) / 10**(priceDecimals + tokenDecimals - 6);\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x2ed1aa61d7940ae01439491650c8c5958200f719c97344213fb8a7803006aa0d","license":"MIT"},"contracts/InzenGovernor.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity =0.8.17;\n\nimport '@openzeppelin/contracts/access/AccessControl.sol';\nimport '@openzeppelin/contracts/governance/extensions/GovernorCountingSimple.sol';\nimport '@openzeppelin/contracts/governance/extensions/GovernorVotesQuorumFraction.sol';\nimport './extensions/EasyGovernor.sol';\nimport './InzenFunds.sol';\n\ncontract InzenGovernor is GovernorVotesQuorumFraction, GovernorCountingSimple, EasyGovernor {\n    bytes32 public constant PORTFOLIO_ENGINEER_ROLE = keccak256('PORTFOLIO_ENGINEER_ROLE');\n\n    uint256 public period;\n\n    address[] private _defaultTargets;\n    uint256[] private _defaultValues;\n\n    event NewPortfolioEngineer(uint256 indexed proposalId, EasyGovernor.EventState state, address user);\n    event RemovePortfolioEngineer(uint256 indexed proposalId, EasyGovernor.EventState state, address user);\n    event Reconfigure(uint256 indexed proposalId, EasyGovernor.EventState state, uint256[] weights);\n    event NewAsset(\n        uint256 indexed proposalId,\n        EasyGovernor.EventState state,\n        ERC20 token,\n        AggregatorV3Interface priceFeed\n    );\n\n    constructor(\n        string memory _name,\n        ERC20Votes _tokenAddress,\n        uint256 _period,\n        uint256 _quorum\n    ) public Governor(_name) GovernorVotes(_tokenAddress) GovernorVotesQuorumFraction(_quorum) {\n        period = _period;\n        _defaultTargets.push(address(_tokenAddress));\n        _defaultValues.push(0);\n    }\n\n    function proposalTopics() external view override returns (bytes32[] memory topics) {\n        topics = new bytes32[](4);\n        topics[0] = NewPortfolioEngineer.selector;\n        topics[1] = RemovePortfolioEngineer.selector;\n        topics[2] = Reconfigure.selector;\n        topics[3] = NewAsset.selector;\n        return topics;\n    }\n\n    function votingDelay() public pure override returns (uint256) {\n        return 0;\n    }\n\n    function votingPeriod() public view override returns (uint256) {\n        return period;\n    }\n\n    function proposeNewPortfolioEngineer(address user) public returns (uint256 proposalId) {\n        require(!AccessControl(address(token)).hasRole(PORTFOLIO_ENGINEER_ROLE, user), 'Role granted');\n        proposalId = defaultPropose(\n            abi.encodeWithSelector(AccessControl.grantRole.selector, PORTFOLIO_ENGINEER_ROLE, user)\n        );\n        emit NewPortfolioEngineer(proposalId, EventState.Propose, user);\n    }\n\n    function executeNewPortfolioEngineer(address user) public returns (uint256 proposalId) {\n        proposalId = defaultExecute(\n            abi.encodeWithSelector(AccessControl.grantRole.selector, PORTFOLIO_ENGINEER_ROLE, user)\n        );\n        emit NewPortfolioEngineer(proposalId, EventState.Execute, user);\n    }\n\n    function proposeRemovePortfolioEngineer(address user) public returns (uint256 proposalId) {\n        require(AccessControl(address(token)).hasRole(PORTFOLIO_ENGINEER_ROLE, user), 'Role not granted');\n        proposalId = defaultPropose(\n            abi.encodeWithSelector(AccessControl.revokeRole.selector, PORTFOLIO_ENGINEER_ROLE, user)\n        );\n        emit RemovePortfolioEngineer(proposalId, EventState.Propose, user);\n    }\n\n    function executeRemovePortfolioEngineer(address user) public returns (uint256 proposalId) {\n        proposalId = defaultExecute(\n            abi.encodeWithSelector(AccessControl.revokeRole.selector, PORTFOLIO_ENGINEER_ROLE, user)\n        );\n        emit RemovePortfolioEngineer(proposalId, EventState.Execute, user);\n    }\n\n    function proposeReconfigure(uint256[] memory _weights) public returns (uint256 proposalId) {\n        proposalId = defaultPropose(abi.encodeWithSelector(InzenFunds.reconfigure.selector, _weights));\n        emit Reconfigure(proposalId, EventState.Propose, _weights);\n    }\n\n    function executeReconfigure(uint256[] memory _weights) public returns (uint256 proposalId) {\n        proposalId = defaultExecute(abi.encodeWithSelector(InzenFunds.reconfigure.selector, _weights));\n        emit Reconfigure(proposalId, EventState.Execute, _weights);\n    }\n\n    function proposeNewAsset(ERC20 _token, AggregatorV3Interface _priceFeed) public returns (uint256 proposalId) {\n        proposalId = defaultPropose(abi.encodeWithSelector(InzenFunds.addAsset.selector, _token, _priceFeed));\n        emit NewAsset(proposalId, EventState.Propose, _token, _priceFeed);\n    }\n\n    function executeNewAsset(ERC20 _token, AggregatorV3Interface _priceFeed) public returns (uint256 proposalId) {\n        proposalId = defaultExecute(abi.encodeWithSelector(InzenFunds.addAsset.selector, _token, _priceFeed));\n        emit NewAsset(proposalId, EventState.Execute, _token, _priceFeed);\n    }\n\n    function defaultPropose(bytes memory data) internal returns (uint256) {\n        bytes[] memory calldatas = new bytes[](1);\n        calldatas[0] = data;\n        return propose(_defaultTargets, _defaultValues, calldatas, '');\n    }\n\n    function defaultExecute(bytes memory data) internal returns (uint256) {\n        bytes[] memory calldatas = new bytes[](1);\n        calldatas[0] = data;\n        return execute(_defaultTargets, _defaultValues, calldatas, keccak256(bytes('')));\n    }\n\n    function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId) public view virtual override(Governor, EasyGovernor) returns (bool) {\n        return super.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xf879805fbe2f5ba4e07ee5ac50880987fa9236f78a1bb90f3fdbb11dd8c38743","license":"MIT"},"contracts/extensions/EasyGovernor.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\nimport '@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/introspection/ERC165.sol';\n\nabstract contract EasyGovernor is ERC165 {\n    enum EventState {\n        Propose,\n        Execute\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns list of proposal topics to listen for\n     */\n    function proposalTopics() external view virtual returns (bytes32[] memory);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IERC165-supportsInterface}.\n     */\n    function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId) public view virtual override returns (bool) {\n        return\n            interfaceId == (type(ERC165).interfaceId ^ this.proposalTopics.selector) ||\n            super.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xebc98846a74b9e033fd12bffafc013e39634eacb7f3eede4f6abb51f462b80fd","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/AggregationRouterV5Interface.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\nimport '@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol';\n\ninterface AggregationRouterV5Interface {\n    struct SwapDescription {\n        ERC20 srcToken;\n        ERC20 dstToken;\n        address payable srcReceiver;\n        address payable dstReceiver;\n        uint256 amount;\n        uint256 minReturnAmount;\n        uint256 flags;\n    }\n\n    function swap(\n        address executor,\n        SwapDescription calldata desc,\n        bytes calldata permit,\n        bytes calldata data\n    ) external payable returns (uint256 returnAmount, uint256 spentAmount);\n\n    function uniswapV3Swap(\n        uint256 amount,\n        uint256 minReturn,\n        uint256[] calldata pools\n    ) external payable returns (uint256 returnAmount);\n}\n","keccak256":"0x02f337a5861705585dfe0ab0cf35808318e9101c96f72bd386688754943f9250","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/AggregatorV3Interface.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\ninterface AggregatorV3Interface {\n    function decimals() external view returns (uint8);\n\n    function description() external view returns (string memory);\n\n    function version() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function getRoundData(uint80 _roundId)\n        external\n        view\n        returns (\n            uint80 roundId,\n            int256 answer,\n            uint256 startedAt,\n            uint256 updatedAt,\n            uint80 answeredInRound\n        );\n\n    function latestRoundData()\n        external\n        view\n        returns (\n            uint80 roundId,\n            int256 answer,\n            uint256 startedAt,\n            uint256 updatedAt,\n            uint80 answeredInRound\n        );\n}\n","keccak256":"0xee3660aea274593d63edbbd67578f591c3502c5046172503d743ba2afaf400db","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/IUniswapV2Router01.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\ninterface IUniswapV2Router01 {\n    function factory() external pure returns (address);\n\n    function WETH() external pure returns (address);\n\n    function addLiquidity(\n        address tokenA,\n        address tokenB,\n        uint256 amountADesired,\n        uint256 amountBDesired,\n        uint256 amountAMin,\n        uint256 amountBMin,\n        address to,\n        uint256 deadline\n    )\n        external\n        returns (\n            uint256 amountA,\n            uint256 amountB,\n            uint256 liquidity\n        );\n\n    function addLiquidityETH(\n        address token,\n        uint256 amountTokenDesired,\n        uint256 amountTokenMin,\n        uint256 amountETHMin,\n        address to,\n        uint256 deadline\n    )\n        external\n        payable\n        returns (\n            uint256 amountToken,\n            uint256 amountETH,\n            uint256 liquidity\n        );\n\n    function removeLiquidity(\n        address tokenA,\n        address tokenB,\n        uint256 liquidity,\n        uint256 amountAMin,\n        uint256 amountBMin,\n        address to,\n        uint256 deadline\n    ) external returns (uint256 amountA, uint256 amountB);\n\n    function removeLiquidityETH(\n        address token,\n        uint256 liquidity,\n        uint256 amountTokenMin,\n        uint256 amountETHMin,\n        address to,\n        uint256 deadline\n    ) external returns (uint256 amountToken, uint256 amountETH);\n\n    function removeLiquidityWithPermit(\n        address tokenA,\n        address tokenB,\n        uint256 liquidity,\n        uint256 amountAMin,\n        uint256 amountBMin,\n        address to,\n        uint256 deadline,\n        bool approveMax,\n        uint8 v,\n        bytes32 r,\n        bytes32 s\n    ) external returns (uint256 amountA, uint256 amountB);\n\n    function removeLiquidityETHWithPermit(\n        address token,\n        uint256 liquidity,\n        uint256 amountTokenMin,\n        uint256 amountETHMin,\n        address to,\n        uint256 deadline,\n        bool approveMax,\n        uint8 v,\n        bytes32 r,\n        bytes32 s\n    ) external returns (uint256 amountToken, uint256 amountETH);\n\n    function swapExactTokensForTokens(\n        uint256 amountIn,\n        uint256 amountOutMin,\n        address[] calldata path,\n        address to,\n        uint256 deadline\n    ) external returns (uint256[] memory amounts);\n\n    function swapTokensForExactTokens(\n        uint256 amountOut,\n        uint256 amountInMax,\n        address[] calldata path,\n        address to,\n        uint256 deadline\n    ) external returns (uint256[] memory amounts);\n\n    function swapExactETHForTokens(\n        uint256 amountOutMin,\n        address[] calldata path,\n        address to,\n        uint256 deadline\n    ) external payable returns (uint256[] memory amounts);\n\n    function swapTokensForExactETH(\n        uint256 amountOut,\n        uint256 amountInMax,\n        address[] calldata path,\n        address to,\n        uint256 deadline\n    ) external returns (uint256[] memory amounts);\n\n    function swapExactTokensForETH(\n        uint256 amountIn,\n        uint256 amountOutMin,\n        address[] calldata path,\n        address to,\n        uint256 deadline\n    ) external returns (uint256[] memory amounts);\n\n    function swapETHForExactTokens(\n        uint256 amountOut,\n        address[] calldata path,\n        address to,\n        uint256 deadline\n    ) external payable returns (uint256[] memory amounts);\n\n    function quote(\n        uint256 amountA,\n        uint256 reserveA,\n        uint256 reserveB\n    ) external pure returns (uint256 amountB);\n\n    function getAmountOut(\n        uint256 amountIn,\n        uint256 reserveIn,\n        uint256 reserveOut\n    ) external pure returns (uint256 amountOut);\n\n    function getAmountIn(\n        uint256 amountOut,\n        uint256 reserveIn,\n        uint256 reserveOut\n    ) external pure returns (uint256 amountIn);\n\n    function getAmountsOut(uint256 amountIn, address[] calldata path) external view returns (uint256[] memory amounts);\n\n    function getAmountsIn(uint256 amountOut, address[] calldata path) external view returns (uint256[] memory Empty().details: An operation (e.g. {front}) couldn't be completed due to the queue being empty.

hashProposal(address[],uint256[],bytes[].details: See {IGovernor-hashProposal}. The proposal id is produced by hashing the ABI encoded `targets` array, the `values` array, the `calldatas` array and the descriptionHash (bytes32 which itself is the keccak256 hash of the description string). This proposal id can be produced from the proposal data which is part of the {ProposalCreated} event. It can even be computed in advance, before the proposal is submitted. Note that the chainId and the governor address are not part of the proposal id computation. Consequently, the same proposal (with same operation and same description) will have the same id if submitted on multiple governors across multiple networks. This also means that in order to execute the same operation twice (on the same governor) the proposer will have to change the description in order to avoid proposal id conflicts.

proposalThreshold().details: Part of the Governor Bravo's interface: _"The number of votes required in order for a voter to become a proposer"_.

proposalTopics().details: Returns list of proposal topics to listen for

proposalVotes(uint256).details: Accessor to the internal vote counts.

quorum(uint256).details: Returns the quorum for a block number, in terms of number of votes: `supply * numerator / denominator`.

quorumDenominator().details: Returns the quorum denominator. Defaults to 100, but may be overridden.

quorumNumerator().details: Returns the current quorum numerator. See {quorumDenominator}.

quorumNumerator(uint256).details: Returns the quorum numerator at a specific block number. See {quorumDenominator}.

relay(address,uint256,bytes).details: Relays a transaction or function call to an arbitrary target. In cases where the governance executor is some contract other than the governor itself, like when using a timelock, this function can be invoked in a governance proposal to recover tokens or Ether that was sent to the governor contract by mistake. Note that if the executor is simply the governor itself, use of `relay` is redundant.

updateQuorumNumerator(uint256).details: Changes the quorum numerator. Emits a {QuorumNumeratorUpdated} event. Requirements: - Must be called through a governance proposal. - New numerator must be smaller or equal to the denominator.

votingDelay().details: Delay, in number of block, between the proposal is created and the vote starts. This can be increassed to leave time for users to buy voting power, or delegate it, before the voting of a proposal starts.

votingPeriod().details: Delay, in number of blocks, between the vote start and vote ends. NOTE: The {votingDelay} can delay the start of the vote. This must be considered when setting the voting duration compared to the voting delay.
